对经济学这门“忧郁的科学”（Dismal Science），我该谈得够多了。一位朋友曾经送给我一件哥伦比亚大学经济学系的T恤，上面的图 …

entry.tran: 忧郁的;凄凉的;令人沮丧的
entry.def: Something that is dismal is bad in a sad or depressing way.

example.tran: 以色列在奥运会上让人沮丧的记录

example.ex: My prospects of returning to a suitable job are dismal...
example.tran: 我重新找到一个合适的工作岗位的希望很渺茫。

entry.tran: (尤指外表)阴暗的，阴沉的，沉闷的
entry.def: Something that is dismal is sad and depressing, especially in appearance.

example.ex: The main part of the hospital is pretty dismal but the children's ward is really lively.
example.tran: 医院的主体部分死气沉沉，但是儿科病房却充满生气。

example.ex: ...a dark dismal day with rain falling steadily...
example.tran: 天空昏暗、阴雨绵绵的一天

sentences.sentence: "in August 1914 , there was a dismally sentimental little dinner, when the French, German, Austrian and Belgian members of the committee drank together to the peace of the future"
"as he looks at the mess he has left behind he must wonder how the Brits so often managed to succeed in the kind of situation where he has so dismally failed"
